item.title: US headline CPI gained 2.9% in the year to December - FXStreet
item.description:
US Headline CPI Increases 2.9% Year-over-Year in December

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 Source: US Bureau of Labor Statistics

Inflation in the US rose by 2.9% in December as CPI readings align with market expectations. The core CPI, which excludes food and energy, rose by 3.2% year-on-year, indicating slight inflationary pressures.

  • US headline CPI increases to 2.9% YoY in December from 2.7% in November.
  • Monthly CPI rose by 0.4%, following a 0.3% increase in November.
  • Core CPI annual inflation currently at 3.2%, slightly below market predictions.
  • Market reactions sees the US Dollar Index drop below key support levels.
  • Federal Reserve likely to maintain interest rates unchanged in January.
“We expect goods deflation to act as a key drag, offsetting housing inflation rebounds.” - TD Securities analysts

While the December CPI report indicates a steady inflation trend, it is unlikely to spur immediate changes in the Federal Reserve's monetary policy.

item.title: Adani Power, Adani Green, Adani Energy Solutions, Adani Enterprises: Why Adani group shares are rising? - ET Now
item.description:
Why Adani Group Shares Are Rising

Updated: Jan 14, 2025 12:38 IST | Source: ET NOW News

Adani group shares are seeing significant price increases following a recent sell-off, mainly responding to improved market sentiment and positive business updates.

  • Adani Power shares jumped nearly 19% to Rs 535.
  • Adani Green surged 13.8% to Rs 1,012.8.
  • Notable price movements also included Adani Energy Solutions rallying 13.7% and Adani Enterprises increasing by 8.9%.
  • The overall market sentiment strengthened after previous lows in benchmark indices.
  • Adani Energy Solutions reported a 29.7% YoY expansion of its transmission network.
  • Major projects secured by Adani Energy Solutions include a Rs 3,455 crore project and a Rs 25,000 crore project.
  • Adani Wilmar shares recovered from a steep drop following a large-scale sale of shares by its promoter.
“The Rajasthan project, its largest to date, increased the under-construction project pipeline to Rs 54,700 crore from Rs 17,000 crore at the start of FY25.”

This recent rally suggests a recovery for Adani group shares, driven by strong business performance and strategic expansions in capacity and project acquisitions.

item.title: LTTS Q3 Results: Net profit at ₹322 crore; targets 10% FY25 revenue growth in Constant Currency - CNBCTV18
item.description:
LTTS Q3 Results: Net Profit at ₹322 Crore; Aiming for 10% Revenue Growth in FY25

Published: January 15, 2025 | Source: CNBC-TV18

L&T Technology Services Ltd. (LTTS) reported a net profit of ₹322.4 crore for Q3, targeting a 10% revenue growth for FY25 in constant currency. The results were slightly below expectations.

  • Net profit of ₹322.4 crore, against expectations of ₹330 crore.
  • Revenue recorded at ₹2,653 crore, a year-on-year growth of 9.5%.
  • Dollar revenue reached $312 million, with an 8.7% year-on-year growth.
  • Highest ever large deal bookings with eight significant deals including one at $50 million.
  • EBIT for the quarter stood at ₹422 crore with a rising EBITDA margin of 16.2%.
“Our large deal TCV has seen a healthy increase with eight wins across segments. The large deal pipeline continues to be robust…” - Amit Chadha, CEO and Managing Director, LTTS

The outlook for LTTS remains optimistic despite a slight miss on expected figures, with planned growth stemming from a strong deal pipeline.

item.title: LTTS Q3 Results: Net profit at ₹322 cr; targets 10% FY25 revenue growth in Constant Currency - CNBCTV18
item.description:
LTTS Q3 Results: Net Profit at ₹322 Crore with 10% Revenue Growth Target

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025 4:14 PM IST  | Source: CNBC TV18

L&T Technology Services Ltd. (LTTS) reported a net profit of ₹322.4 crore for Q3, below expectations, and is targeting 10% revenue growth in Constant Currency for FY25.

  • Net profit of ₹322.4 crore compared to ₹330 crore expected.
  • Revenue of ₹2,653 crore, a 9.5% year-on-year growth.
  • Dollar revenue reached $312 million, up 3.1% quarter-on-quarter.
  • EBIT for the quarter at ₹422 crore, surpassing expectations.
  • Largest ever large deal bookings with eight significant contracts.
“Our large deal TCV has seen a healthy increase with eight wins across segments.” - Amit Chadha, CEO and Managing Director.

The company's performance indicates a strong pipeline of large deals, although the current quarter's financial results were slightly below market expectations.

item.title: ‘Some dues left..’: Mallikarjun Kharge's jibe at L&T chairman's call to work on Sundays - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Some dues left..’: Mallikarjun Kharge's jibe at L&T chairman's call to work on Sundays

Date: Jan 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Mallikarjun Kharge, the Congress president, expressed his disagreement with L&T chairman Subrahmanyan's proposal for a 90-hour workweek, referencing historical viewpoints on worker rights and the importance of work-life balance. His remarks were made during an address at the inauguration of the Congress' new headquarters in Delhi.

  • Kharge sarcastically thanked L&T for building the new headquarters but criticized the idea of extended work hours.
  • He recalled Nehru and Ambedkar's advocacy for an eight-hour workday.
  • Kharge mentioned previous discussions about a 70-hour workweek by former Infosys chairman Narayana Murthy.
  • The L&T chairman's comments on wanting employees to work on Sundays sparked significant controversy.
“Some dues are also left from our side,” Kharge said to peals of laughter from the attendees.

Kharge's critique highlights the ongoing debate about work hours and employee well-being, emphasizing the need for balance in modern work environments.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Trade Higher; Broader Indices Outperform - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Highlights: Nifty, Sensex Extend Gains For Second Straight Session

Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

The NSE Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex extended gains for the second straight session ahead of the US CPI data, with key stocks showing positive movement.

  • The Nifty 50 ended 37.15 points or 0.16% higher at 23,213.20.
  • The Sensex ended 224.45 points or 0.29% higher at 76,724.08.
  • Top gainers included NTPC, Trent Ltd, and Power Grid Corporation Ltd.
  • Sector performance saw Nifty Realty rise the most while Nifty Media declined.
  • Market breadth indicated 2,144 stocks rose, while 1,808 fell.
“The Nifty 50 rose 0.51% to a day's high of 23,293.65.”

Overall, the market sentiment remained cautiously optimistic as traders awaited further cues.

item.title: Hero Quietly Launches THIS New Affordable Scooter; 59 Kmpl Mileage, Mobile Connectivity, Maps And More - See Price - Zee News
item.description:
Hero Quietly Launches THIS New Affordable Scooter; 59 Kmpl Mileage, Mobile Connectivity, Maps And More - See Price

Date: Not specified Source: Zee News

Introduction: Hero MotoCorp has introduced the updated 2025 Destini 125 scooter ahead of the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, featuring enhancements and competitive pricing.

  • Price: Starting at Rs 80,450 (ex-showroom, Delhi) for the base variant.
  • Variants: Three trims available - VX, ZX, and ZX+.
  • Features: Includes illuminated switches, under-seat storage lighting, Bluetooth connectivity, and real-time mileage info.
  • Design: Neo-retro design with copper-toned accents and LED lights.
  • Engine: 124.6cc engine delivering 9 bhp and 10.4 Nm with claimed mileage of 59 kmpl.
“Hero claims the scooter offers a mileage of 59 kmpl as it comes with i3S idle stop-start system technology.”

Conclusion: The 2025 Hero Destini 125 stands out in its segment with modern features and competitive pricing, poised to compete against established rivals.

item.title: Kalyan Jewellers shares tank to a 10% lower circuit, down in eight out of nine sessions - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Kalyan Jewellers Shares Plunge to 10% Lower Circuit Amid Trading Decline

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

Kalyan Jewellers India Ltd. faces a 10% lower circuit lock today, marking a 32% drop over the past nine trading sessions despite strong revenue growth reported in December.

  • Kalyan Jewellers locked in a 10% lower circuit on January 15, 2025.
  • The stock has dropped 32% in the last nine trading sessions.
  • The company reported a consolidated revenue growth of 39% for the December quarter.
  • In Q3, Kalyan's India revenue grew by 41%, driven by festive and wedding demand.
  • The company opened 24 new showrooms in India during the last quarter.
  • Eight out of nine analysts maintain a 'Buy' rating on the stock.
“Short-term volatility may have occurred due to profit-booking, corrections, or broader macroeconomic factors.” - Ramesh Kalyanaraman, Executive Director

The significant drop in shares warrants attention, but experts suggest it may represent a buying opportunity for investors.

item.title: Mahindra To Showcase 4 New SUVs At Auto Expo! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Mahindra To Showcase 4 New SUVs At Auto Expo

Date: January 25, 2025
Source: MotorOctane

The upcoming Auto Expo is set to feature exciting new electric SUVs from Mahindra, showcasing models like the Rall-E concept, XEV 7e, XUV3XO EV, and Thar E.

  • Mahindra will present the Rall-E concept, an off-road variant of the BE 6 with rugged design and accessories.
  • The XEV 7e will be based on the XUV700 and offer three-row seating and advanced features.
  • The XUV3XO EV is expected to debut with designs from the XUV3XO, emphasizing affordability and performance.
  • The Thar E aims to build on the success of the Thar Roxx with a 5-door layout and advanced off-road capability.
“The Thar E will explore the off-road segment further with an AWD configuration, enhancing its appeal.”

This Auto Expo is set to be vital for Mahindra as it positions itself strongly in the growing electric vehicle market in India.

item.title: 'Look to yourself if employees aren't working...': Raghuram Rajan responds to L&T chief's 90-hour work week pitch - Business Today
item.description:
'Look to yourself if employees aren't working...': Raghuram Rajan responds to L&T chief's 90-hour work week pitch

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: Business Today

Former Reserve Bank of India Governor Raghuram Rajan criticized L&T Chairperson SN Subrahmanyan's suggestion of a 90-hour work week, stating it reflects generational complaints about younger workers.

  • Rajan believes there cannot be a one-size-fits-all approach to work hours.
  • He emphasized the importance of individuals finding balance in their work and personal interests.
  • Subrahmanyan's comments ignited backlash regarding work-life balance considerations.
  • Experts suggest that quality of work should trump quantity of hours worked.
“If they're not working to the extent that you want them to work in your firm, look to yourself what is it that you're doing wrong in incentivising them.” - Raghuram Rajan

Rajan concluded that meaningful work cannot be reduced to rigid designs and that fulfilling work is often subjective.

item.title: Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg in India in his first overseas visit - The Hindu
item.description:
Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg Visits India

Published Date: January 15, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Boeing’s new President and CEO, Kelly Ortberg, is in India for his first international visit, focusing on business meetings with customers and key government stakeholders.

  • Ortberg's itinerary includes visits to Boeing facilities in Hyderabad and Bengaluru.
  • Meetings with Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman took place.
  • Collaborations between Boeing and Tata for manufacturing aerostructures are ongoing.
  • Ortberg faces challenges as Boeing contends with regulatory scrutiny and production delays.
“Grateful to @nsitharaman for a productive discussion with @Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg. Our partnership with India continues to grow.” - Salil Gupte

Ortberg’s visit addresses both opportunities and challenges in the aviation sector, illustrating Boeing's commitment to India despite ongoing difficulties in aircraft production.

item.title: Boeing CEO in India in his first overseas visit - The Hindu
item.description:
Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg Visits India for First Overseas Engagement

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Boeing’s new President and CEO Kelly Ortberg is in India this week for his first international visit since taking over in August. His agenda includes meetings with Boeing customers and key government stakeholders, along with visits to Boeing’s facilities.

  • Ortberg's visit spans nearly three days.
  • Meetings with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and other Boeing executives were held.
  • Boeing has a joint venture with Tata in aerospace manufacturing in India.
  • Challenges faced by Boeing include regulatory oversight and production slowdowns.
  • Delays in 737 MAX deliveries are impacting Indian airlines.
“Grateful to @nsitharaman for a productive discussion with @Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg. Our partnership with India continues to grow...” - Salil Gupte, President of Boeing India

Ortberg's visit reflects Boeing's commitment to expanding its presence in India despite ongoing challenges in production and delivery.

item.title: 'Amul stares at bread daily': Dairy brand joins 90-hour workweek controversy with new doodle - The Times of India
item.description:
Amul Joins 90-Hour Workweek Debate with New Doodle

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In a recent twist to the ongoing 90-hour workweek controversy, Amul has released a new doodle that captures public attention and reflects the brand's engagement with current social issues.

  • The doodle addresses the intense debates around work-life balance and labor rights.
  • Amul's campaign symbolizes corporate awareness of social issues affecting employees.
  • It has sparked discussions across various social media platforms.
"Amul's doodles often resonate with the public, creating cultural connections and sparking conversations on important topics."

This campaign not only highlights Amul's marketing creativity but also underlines the importance of addressing contemporary workplace issues in India.

item.title: NIFTY50 rejig: Zomato, Jio Financial may join NIFTY50, replacing BPCL and Britannia; check details - Upstox
item.description:
Zomato and Jio Financial Likely to Join NIFTY50 in Upcoming Rejig

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 Source: JM Financial

Zomato and Jio Financial Services are set to replace BPCL and Britannia in the NIFTY50 index during its semi-annual rejig in March.

  • Zomato and Jio Financial are expected to be included in NIFTY50 based on free-float market cap.
  • JM Financial expects Zomato to see inflows of ₹5,364 crore if included.
  • Jio Financial could see inflows of ₹3,080 crore.
  • Inclusion criteria require a market impact cost of 0.5% or less and trading in futures/options.
  • BPCL and Britannia may face significant outflows if excluded.
"If Zomato is included in NIFTY 50, it may see an inflow of $620 million, or ₹5,364 crore, which is 3.8 times its average daily trading volume."

In conclusion, the upcoming reshuffle of the NIFTY50 index may significantly impact the trading dynamics of Zomato and Jio Financial, while BPCL and Britannia face potential outflows.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty Rises Over 0.20% As NTPC, Power Grid Lead; Sensex Trades Above 76,700 - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty Rises Over 0.20% As NTPC, Power Grid Lead; Sensex Trades Above 76,700

Publication Date: 15 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

Indian stock indices are showing positive movements today, with both Nifty and Sensex rising significantly, propelled by major stocks such as NTPC and Power Grid.

  • Nifty rose by 0.51%, reaching 23,293.65 points.
  • Sensex increased by 0.64%, hitting 76,991.05 points.
  • Broader indices like Nifty Midcap and Smallcap also advanced.
  • NTPC, Power Grid, and Trent emerged as top gainers on the Nifty.
  • HDFC Life, Mahindra & Mahindra, and Bajaj Finance were noted as top losers.
“The stock market is reacting positively with major gains across sectors.”

The trends suggest a bullish sentiment in the market, with investors optimistic about upcoming corporate earnings and overall economic stability.

item.title: CISA Released a Free AI Cybersecurity Collaboration Playbook (PDF) - CybersecurityNews
item.description:
CISA Released a Free AI Cybersecurity Collaboration Playbook

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has unveiled the AI Cybersecurity Collaboration Playbook, a new guidance document designed to enhance collaboration and information sharing to combat cybersecurity threats associated with AI.

  • Promotes collaboration among federal agencies and private sectors to increase awareness of AI cybersecurity risks.
  • Provides guidance for incident and vulnerability reporting related to AI.
  • Outlines safeguards for shared information and how CISA processes this information.
  • Encourages voluntary participation without legal mandates.
“CISA’s playbook underscores the importance of shared vigilance and cooperation...”

CISA’s AI Cybersecurity Collaboration Playbook marks a significant step towards collective defense against evolving cyber threats targeting AI systems.

item.title: 2025 Hero Destini 125 Launched In India: Check Price, Features - NDTV
item.description:
2025 Hero Destini 125 Launched In India: Check Price, Features

Publication Date: October 2023   Source: Hero MotoCorp Press Release

The updated Hero Destini 125 scooter has been launched in India, featuring a new design and enhanced features.

This new iteration includes a 125 cc engine, improved mileage, and modern technology.

  • Starting price of Rs 80,450 (ex-showroom).
  • Available in three variants with the most expensive priced at Rs 90,300.
  • Enhanced mileage of 59 kmpl.
  • New curvy design with LED headlight and various paint options.
  • Features a 125 cc engine producing 9 bhp and 10.4 Nm torque.
  • Smartphone connectivity with turn-by-turn navigation.
  • First-time disc brakes available on the ZX variants.
“The brand has refreshed the appeal of the Hero Destini 125 with a new curvy design.”

The launch of the Hero Destini 125 aims to cater to the growing scooter market in India, emphasizing performance and features.

item.title: Mid-day Mood | Sensex falls 500 points from day's high, Nifty breaks below 23,200 - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Mid-day Mood | Sensex falls 500 points from day's high, Nifty breaks below 23,200

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

The market showed volatility as Sensex dropped significantly from its high, with various sectors reflecting mixed performance. Analysts spotted a bullish harami pattern, indicating potential future gains.

  • Sensex fell nearly 500 points from the day's high, trading around 76,504.
  • Nifty dropped below the 23,200 mark amid a flat trading session.
  • Market breadth remained positive with 2,123 shares advancing versus 1,296 shares declining.
  • Analysts recommend pushing Nifty above 23,340 for further gains.
“The Nifty’s rebound has formed a 'bullish harami' pattern.”

The current market conditions indicate caution, yet opportunities for recovery exist as indicated by market analysts.

item.title: YES Bank, IREDA, Paytm, MGL: Top mid-cap and small-cap stocks that MFs lapped up in December | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
YES Bank, IREDA, Paytm, MGL: Top mid-cap and small-cap stocks that MFs lapped up in December

Publication Date: December 2023 Source: Live Mint

Mutual funds (MFs) have been actively buying mid-cap and small-cap stocks, influencing market trends and offering higher potential returns with increased risk.

Key Points:

  • In December, MFs were net buyers of 60% of Nifty Midcap 100 and 53% of Nifty Smallcap 100 stocks.
  • Top purchases included Yes Bank, HUDCO, Tata Elxsi, Godrej Properties, and IREDA.
  • Yes Bank saw a 166.7% month-on-month increase in MFs' stake, totaling ₹430 crore.
  • In HUDCO, MFs increased stakes by 93%, while Tata Elxsi increased by 77.6%.
  • Signature Global and Mahanagar Gas were the top small-cap purchases, with increases between 12-40%.
  • Profits were booked in Tata Technologies and Vodafone Idea, with stakes reduced by 16% and 13%, respectively.
  • Overall, MFs recorded a net inflow of ₹41,155 crore in equity mutual funds in December, marking a near 15% increase from the previous month.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“Retail investors often gravitate towards mid-cap and small-cap stocks as these counters have the possibility of delivering higher returns but at the cost of higher risk.”

Conclusion:

The active buying from MFs in mid-cap and small-cap stocks signals a positive outlook despite inherent risks, with significant shifts in shareholding across key companies offering insights for retail investors.
